results.title: World War I: The Background
results.brief_description: Uses historical newsreel footage to review the basic causes and international incidents which led to World War I. The militaristic and nationalistic rivalry, entangling alliances, and international tension of the prewar years, dating back to 1870; the Balkan conflict, ententes and alliances, and the Sarajevo incident, leading to the declaration of war.
results.description: Uses historical newsreel footage to review the basic causes and international incidents which led to World War I. results.title: World War I: Building the peace
results.brief_description: The treaty of Versailles; its provisions and how it failed. Historic newsreel footage shows Wilson, Lloyd George and Clemenceau, and scenes of the conference at Versailles. A discussion of the Treaty of Versailles; points out that it was written as a series of compromises; its provisions and effects on the map and peoples of Europe; the League of Nations as an integral part of the Treaty, and the failure of the Treaty to ensure a lasting peace.

results.title: World War I: background tensions (1870-1914). - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Bill Walker, Don B. Klugman and Coronet
results.brief_description: Beginning with the Franco-Prussian War of 1870. This film works its way methodically through the events that culminated in World War I. Uses maps, photographs and documentary film footage of these events and of such famous contemporary figures as Kaiser Wilhelm, Czar Nicholas II, Bismarck, Churchill and Poincare. Concludes with a summary of why each nation went to war.

results.title: World War I. The Day the guns stopped firing: 1918
results.brief_description: Focuses on events influencing Germany’s decision to ask for a negotiated settlement of World War I; the reaction of Germany and the Allies to news of the armistice; and the long range implications of peace. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: World safari 1: The incredible journey
results.brief_description: Describes the adventures of two Australian men through 56 countries and four continents, a total of 120,000 kilometres, over a period of six years.

results.title: World population
results.brief_description: A highly effective visual depiction of the explosive growth rate of the human population over the past two thousand years. Small white dots, each representing one million people slowly appear on map of the world’s continents. Growth increases at a rate which indicates that population may drain the earth’s resources.

results.title: World of up close
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the unique properties of objects viewed in close-up. It emphasises the importance of colour, shape and texture in identifying familiar objects, while stimulating curiosity about things that cannot be seen unaided by the human eye.

results.title: World of the weed
results.creator_credit: David Germer, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Richard Scott
results.brief_description: A dry but carefully measured historical account of marijuana use around the world. From its use in the Chinese Imperial court and as a ritual aid to Hindi mysticism in India, pharmacological properties of hemp have been recognised and exploited over succeeding epochs. Although the film is too broad in its scope to dwell at length on this subject, the film does present an intriguing analysis of more recent attempts at prohibition, which parallel the rise of industrial capitalism and advances in state regulation of civilian behavioural norms.
